I can’t do it. These sequels don’t know when to stop. They just keep recycling the same shit. Even the opening scene. Some random girl gets a call that undoubtedly ends in her getting killed. It’s all so predictable, there’s no element of surprise, you see everything coming...

The morning sun shines bright over the quaint town of Woodsboro, California. Little moments of small town life are all around. Picture perfect. Innocent. Quiet. Then-- SIRENS BLARE as SQUAD CARS tear down Main Street, racing, speeding... interrupting any hope of a peaceful day.

What inspired you to write about your life?

You survived not one, but three horrific nightmares. I saw the movies when I was a kid. So scary.

I didn’t want to be defined by the word victim anymore. Writing this book was about letting it go. I wanted to be free of my past and move on once and for all. Sidney looks and sounds great. Full of resilience and inn peace. This is a woman who has weathered a great storm. CLOSE ON GALE as she takes this in. Affected.

Well, your book put me in tears. It’s such a beautiful and moving story of survival. Everyone should read it. Buy it today, people. OUT OF THE DARK by Sidney Prescott. Sidney laughs at the TV Host’s shameless plug as the Host holds up Sid’s book. Her picture graces the cover.

Between the book tour and speaking engagements, I’m writing another book. So, we’ll see. It’s alla new adventure.  23 Sidney smiles. Genuinely happy. Gale CLICKS -- Sid disappears. Jenny Randall and Marnie Cooper were murdered last night. The room erupts in SHOCK. Jill turns to Kirby. What? Then the BELL RINGS. Quickly, the class empties out. The news taking everyone’s attention. Jill and Kirby start out.
Who called you this morning?  30
I don’t know. But it came from Jenny’s phone.
This just got creepy. They exit the room.
On the lawn, TV CAMERAMEN hop out and jockey for position TV REPORTERS are quickly starting stand-ups:
...the murdered girls were students here, at Woodsboro High School...
...this week marks the 15 year anniversary of the infamous Woodsboro Murders...
+..as recounted in the bestseller by Gale Weathers which launched the horror franchise STAB... A CROWD has gathered to watch. Shocked. Olivia sees Kirby and Jill exit the school. She races over.

Do you believe this? Didn’t Jenny call you this morning? A look of dread has washed over Jill’s face. And, as if o cue -- Lady Gaga’s TELEPHONE starts playing. Jill reaches into her bag and withdraws her phone. She looks at the CALLER ID. It reads JENNY RANDALL. Jill nearly GASPS. She looks to her friends. All three of them are freaking out. Beat. Finally, Jill answers it. Silence
Congratulations, Jill.
Who is this?
I pick you.
What?  31 Kirby grabs Jill’s phone, puts it on SPEAKER.
Who is it?
I pick you. Don’t disappoint me. CLICK. The phone goes dead. The three girls look at each other. Stunned. Terrified.
A bull pen. Surrounded by offices. A FLURRY of activity. As DEPUTIES come and go. A chaotic atmosphere. Gale moves through the bull pen. She looks around. Sees Deputy Hicks.
Excuse me, Deputy Judy, where’s Dewey? Deputy Hicks looks a bit put out. She’s not a big fan of Dewey's wife. But she’s professional about it.
He’s conducting an interview at the moment.
With Sidney Prescott? Are they in the conference room? I/’11 just head back. Gale starts towards the back corridor, but Hicks blocks h
You can’t go back there, Gale.
Since when? I’m married to the Sheriff, I’m part of the team. Gale starts for the hallway again. But Hicks means busine
It’s a murder investigation. I’m sorry. Gale’s instinct is to rip Hicks’ head off, but lets it go Decides to play the “good wife”. But she’s annoyed.  32
Jill sits at the conference table with Dewey. Her mother, Kate, is next to her, supportive. Along with Sidney.
“I pick you.”
That’s what he said.
What does it mean, Dewey?
I can’t answer that yet.
Am I in danger, Sheriff?
To be honest, we don’t have enough to go on at the moment. Dewey's eyes meet Sidney. Who appears strong and composed She squeezes Jill’s hand, reassuringly.
No, you’re not. Because we’re not going to let anything happen to you, Jill. Jill looks at them, trying to stay calm.
Gale pours a cup of coffee, waiting, when she sees... Sidney’s assistant, Rebecca, who has taken over a desk. S has her iPad out, Blackberry in hand, and headset in her

(on phone, compassionate) No comment beyond Miss Prescott’s sincere condolences to the victim's family and friends. Thank you. (next call) This is Rebecca. (instantly ecstatic) OHMYFUCKINGGOD, Henry. Two girls were butchered. Payday. And I was so not feeling Woodsboro. I was like lame PR move, right? Well, FUCKMEWOW. Best. Idea. Ever.  33 Rebecca spots Gale watching her. Gives a wave.
(on the phone) Henry, I’11 call you back. Rebecca clicks off. Goes to Gale. In awe.
I have to geek out. I didn’t get a chance earlier. It’s an honor to meet you. When I was a kid, it was all about, “TOP STORY with Gale Weathers.” You were my 90's.
It’s Gale Riley now.
Aw. And you gave it all up for love. I bow down. That is so... not me. Gale’s not sure she likes this girl. She’s not a bitch. Just talky and self-involved.
So you're Sidney’s assistant?
I’m covering the book tour for Random. So, yes, I am assisting Sidney, but I wear a lot of hats so if you need anything. Rebecca slides Gale her business card. Gale takes it. Hmm
How long have you and Dewey been married?
Almost ten years ago.
Aw. So it was just like your characters in STAB 3. Wow.
Yeah, wow.  34

I didn’t mean bad wow. It just always seemed like more of a movie romance than a real one because it was a movie and in real life you two would never be... (catches herself) Ooh, don’t wanna dig that hole, so, how many kids do you have? Gale stares at her, blankly. As the hole gets deeper.
Several MEDIA OUTLETS have planted themselves outside the POLICE STATION. Olivia and Kirby watch the ruckus from th water fountain. Charlie is there too.
I don’t understand why the killer called Jill?
She’s been tapped. She’s related to Sidney. It makes it personal.
It puts Jill up next on the victim chain. If the killer calls, you're dead, that’s the rule.
An overused, done to death rule.
You can blame techno J-horror.
What?
(explains) THE RING, GRUDGE, ONE MISSED CALL. Charlie and Kirby talk in a language that is foreign to Olivia.
Someone's gotta bite it. You can’t kill Sidney. She’s victim royalty, she can’t die.  35
Sure she can. Her character has been gone since STAB 3 anyway.
Too dicey. Potential backlash.
Laurie Strode bit it in HALLOWEEN 8, Ripley died in ALIEN 4. There’s precedence. Olivia is completely confused by their conversation.
What are you guys talking about?
(duh) STAB. Someone’s gonna make a sequel outta this. “STAB 8: RETURN TO WOODSBORO.” Charlie breaks out with the HALLOWEEN score while Kirby mimics FRIDAY THE 13TH.
Da-DA-da-DA-da-da... Ki-ki-ki-ma-ma-ma...
This is real. This isn’t a movie.
But it will be. And that Charlie and Kirby are certain of. INT. SHERIFF’S OFFICE - DAY Deputy Hicks fills Dewey in on her findings.
The cyber team is running a full surveillance on the cell phones. As soon as we get something--
I want round the clock watch on Jill and Sidney. Use Hoss and Perkins.
Any statement to the press?  36
No comment. Hicks nods. Sees the strain on her boss’ face.
We'll get through this, Dewey. She gives him a supportive smile. Just then, Gale plows i his office. Hicks starts to object but Dewey allows it.
It’s okay. Judy exits, trying to hide her disdain. Beat. As Dewey ey Gale. A long, strained look. This is hard on him.
Do you have a suspect?
We don’t have enough as this point.

Yea, but we’ve been down this road before. It’s a certain type of killer that’s attracted to Sidney Prescott. It shouldn’t be too hard to find a horror movie freak with a motive and a cell phone. Dewey stares at her in amazement. She stares back. What?
You’re excited about this.
I’m trying to be proactive before someone else is killed.
No, you're really excited about this.
I had a cup of coffee. What?
This is an official murder investigation. You can’t be a part of it.
I’m not a reporter anymore.  37
You're not a cop either, Gale. Beat. This hits Gale hard. It’s impact speaks to a much bigger problem. Dewey’s look is apologetic, but he’s also very busy.
I’m sorry, I’ve got work to do. He exits, hurriedly. Leaving Gale floored.

A PATROL CAR is parked in front of the house. INT. FOYER - ROBERT’S HOUSE - NIGHT A large, old home. Not a lot of money. But comfortable. Hoss is moving from room to room, checking it out. Perkin can be seen going up the stairs. Detective Hicks can be seen in the kitchen with Kate. They're doing an official house, “Clear.”
Perkins checks out the guest room. He looks in the closet checks the windows. Secures them. The bedroom faces the front of the house. His eyes scan the front yard and stre
Rebecca and Sidney are in the living room with their lugg
I had reservations at the Doubletree.
It'll be better here. All of us in numbers. We’1l be safer. Rebecca is resigned to make the most of it.
As long as we’re in Seattle by Tuesday. So what’s the deal with your Aunt? Where’s Jill’s dad?
Aunt Kate is my mother’s kid sister. (MORE )
They're pretty much my only family now. And the father’s not in the picture, so don’t ask. Rebecca nods. Got it. Just then, Jill enters.
I can’t get over how grown up you are. What’s it been five years?
It was the body morphing years.

It’s good to see you. Even though... Jill nods. Gets the sentiment. She feels the same way. A KNOCK at the door. In seconds -- ALL THREE DEPUTIES SWARM TO THE FRONT DOOR. Sidney and Ji do a double-take. Impressive. INT. FOYER - ROBERT’S HOUSE - NIGHT Hicks opens the door to reveal Dewey -- eyeing his wrist watch.
I'm impressed. Hicks smiles. Charmed by his boyish test. He enters. Look to Jill and Sidney.
I found a girl loitering outside.
Step aside, Sheriff. Kirby appears with take-out food.
Fried fat. Who’s with me? She enters. Jill's happy to see her.
Kate and Jill are preparing take-out while Rebecca pours wine, all chatty.  39
I was gonna cook. I do know how. Thank you, hon. Kate takes a glass of wine. Drinks.
This smells yummie.
Oh good, you eat real food, I was worried. Jill looks to the family room where Dewey and Sidney are sitting on the couch.
Sidney and Dewey sit on the couch and catch up.
It’s a 30 city tour. Barnes & Nobles, Seattle is next up. It’s not easy to generate interest in inspirational self-help.
You have the STAB audience.
That audience doesn’t read books. Shocker. Rebecca interrupts with wine. Dewey sets his glass down o the coffee table. He’s “on duty”. Rebecca returns to the kitchen.
How have you been?
You're very calm for what’s going on around you.
I can’t control what other people do. Now, how are you? How’s Gale? Sidney is positive and friendly. Dewey finds it disarming
I’m good and Gale is... well, it’s been a little rocky lately.  He shrugs. 40
I’m sorry to hear that.
She's not working and I don’t think she knows who she is if she’s not working.
Why isn’t she?
She was tabloid TV. The internet killed a lot of that. She hosted that True Crime cable show for a while but... it was canceled.
Isn't she writing another book? Sidney gets it. Feels for her friend.
Gale's smart, she'll figure it out. Dewey nods. Hopeful. He stares at Sid. Impressed. She leans
You sure did. You really got it together. in -- whispers.
I’m scared shitless. Ssh.
That makes more sense. (then) It’s really nice to see you, Sid. Sid smiles. She’s happy to see him too.
A light breeze. Leaves blow across the lawn. Hoss can be seen sitting in a car, parked in front. Dewey exits the house and moves down the walk to his JEEP He waves at Deputy Hoss.
Eyes up, Hoss.  4l Hoss waves back.
Sidney is brushing her teeth. She spits, rinses, exits.

Sidney moves down the hallway -- at the end is a door, slightly ajar. Sid peaks in to reveal. Rebecca is sleeping with her ear buds in -- her iPod layi across her chest. Sid quietly closes the door, turns and RUNS SMACK into DEPUTY HICKS. Sid JUMPS.
Sorry about that. I was just making my rounds.
No, it’s okay.
Dewey left. He’s on cell if you need him. I’ve got Perkins in the back and Hoss in front. Just shout.
Thanks. Sid starts to her room when--

You don’t remember me, do ya? We went to high school together. Judy Hicks. We had the same home room. Sidney studies her a moment, tries to recall. DEPUTY HICKS (CONT’D) And Drama Club, too. We were in Peter Pan together. I played a lost boy... you were Tiger Lily. Sidney smiles politely. She still doesn’t remember. Deput Hicks tries to hide her disappointment. DEPUTY HICKS (CONT’D) It’s okay. You had a lot of stuff going on back then. And, well, I guess I wasn’t very memorable. Awkward. Then...  42

It’s nice to see you again, Judy. Sid disappears down the hall. Hicks stares after her. Bummed. And just a little irked too. INT. JILL’S BEDROOM - NIGHT CLOSE ON THE TV SCREEN -- where two appropriate D-LIST ST have sex. The phone RINGS. Bad acting ensues.
I don’t wanna watch this. It’s in poor taste.
Were you BFF’s with Jenny or Marnie? I don’t think so.
That's not the point.
It’s cathartic, we’re de- sensitizing our grief. ON TV -- THE D-LIST ACTRESS SCREAMS as she’s STABBED. A KNOCK at the door. Both GIRLS jump. Kirby hits PAUSE.
Come in. The door opens -- it’s Sidney.
You guys doing okay in here? Sidney looks to the TV. Sees the STAB movie on PAUSE.
We were just... when in Rome.
Is this the one where Amy Poehler is the killer?
Well, it’s Heidi Klum first, then after the plastic surgery goes wrong, it’s Amy Poehler. She kills all the skinny girls from the CW.  43
Right. Well, good-night. Sid’s cool about. She exits, closes the door.
(idiot) “When in Rome?”
I’m star-struck. DATELINE did a whole hour on her once. I watched it five times. She’s the shit.

Sidney enters the guest bedroom. She goes to her open sui case and finds lotion. She hops up on the bed and gets comfortable. INT. JILL’S BEDROOM - ROBERTS HOUSE - NIGHT Kirby’s CELL PHONE RINGS. She looks at the CALLER ID: OLIVIA.
(answers ) Yes, Olivia?
Olivia's car pulls up in her driveway across the street.

(into her cell) Is that your car? Are you at Jill's? Kirby jumps up, looks out the window. Sees Olivia getting out of her car across the street. They wave. Olivia moves up the walk to her house. It’s dark inside.
Great. My mom’s not home yet. Let me speak to Jill. Kirby hands Jill the phone.
She wants to speak to you. Jill takes the phone.  44
What’s up?
How are you? Did I miss anything?
Nope. I’m okay.
I'll be over in a few. I saw Trevor at practice tonight.
What was he doing there? Olivia enters her house. CLICKS on a light. Locks the doo
Picking up his equipment. He’s done. They kicked him off the team.
I know.
Did he tell you about A&M? He lost the scholarship too. Jill pauses. She didn’t know that.
The guy’s ruined. All for smoking a joint in the Locker Room.
It was the Girl’s Locker Room.
I know, I know... Just then, Jill’s CELL PHONE RINGS. Kirby eyes it on the night stand. READS the CALLER ID: CHARLIE.
It’s Charlie. (answers it) What do you want?
(from phone) Hello, Jill?  45 It’s not Charlie -- it’s the voice of Ghost Face.
Nope, it’s Kirby. Why are you doing this, Charlie?
I’m not Charlie.
What are you doing with Charlie's phone. Huh? Mr. Ghost Face? (to Jill) It’s Charlie being an asshole. Jill waves it away. She can’t deal with him now. She goes back to Olivia.
Do you think he fooled around with Jessica?
Shotgun make-out, yes. Full on blow job, doubt it. Jill nods. She completely agrees.
(to Kirby) I want to talk to Jill.
(to Man) She doesn’t want to talk to you. IN OLIVIA'S BEDROOM - She’s changing into sweats.
Then again, Jessica’s a little hoochie le-whore.
C'mon, Ghost Face, talk to me. Aren’t you supposed to ask me a question. Go ahead, horror quiz me, Cuz’, you know Charlie -- you can’t stump me.
How’s the movie?
What movie?  46 Kirby stops. Goes silent.
How do you know we’re watching that?
Because I’m standing in the closet. Kirby spins around to Jill’s closed closet door.
Stop. You are not. Jill sees Kirby staring at her closet door.
(to Kirby) What’s going on?
(to Jill) Charlie’s being a dick.
Then who the fuck are you?
Open the closet door.
You do know there’s cops all over this house.
I think I’d have just enough time to slice someone open. Beat. Kirby grows cautious. Chilled.
(to Kirby) Are you still talking to Charlie?
(on cell to Jill) What’s going on over there?  47
(to Olivia) Kirby is being weird. Kirby stares at the closet. She’s hesitating.
(to man) There’s no way you’re in there. Kirby reaches for the door knob. Her hand shakes some.
(to Kirby) What are you doing? Suddenly, she RIPS THE CLOSET DOOR OPEN. It’s empty. Reli floods Kirby's face.
(to man) Liar. I’m over this.

I never said I was in your closet. SMASH CUT TO OLIVIA’S BEDROOM Olivia is still on the phone with Jill when... A GHOST FACED FIGURE EXPLODES FROM HER CLOSET. Surprised and stunned -- she barely has time to react whe the GHOST FACE is upon her. BACK IN JILL’S BEDROOM Both Jill and Kirby HEAR OLIVIA SCREAM.
Olivia? Olivia?

What’s happening? They turn to each other. Olivia can be heard SCREAMING fr both of their phones. IN OLIVIA’S BEDROOM A LARGE BUTCHER KNIFE STRIKES. It tears into Olivia’s arm slicing her flesh. She SCREAMS and TUMBLES backwards. The cell phone hits the floor.  48 ON JILL AND KIRBY -- Confused. Crazed. They race to the window and look across the street. They can make out a struggle, a Ghost Face... but then the light goes out.
Olivia... what’s happening? Olivia? Nooo... Olivia? IN SIDNEY’S BEDROOM Sidney HEARS SCREAMING. She bolts from her bed.

As she tries in vain to flee. But the Ghost Face cuts her off, SMASHING into her. She goes CRASHING to the floor. S crawls to her knees and tries again. The GHOST FACE is upon her again. KNIFE RAISED. Olivia CRIES OUT -- one last blood curdling SCREAM.
Nooooo!!! CLICK. Both lines go dead. A moment of frozen horror. Both girls are SCREAMING IN TERROR when Sidney comes raci into the room. They point to the window. Sidney goes to the window.

The house -- Olivia! SIDNEY’S POV - The house is now dark. Suddenly, a FLASHIN LIGHT takes her eye. IT COMES FROM OLIVIA’S UPSTAIRS BEDROOM. CLOSE ON SIDNEY’S FACE -- OVERCOME WITH HORROR As she stares into Olivia’s bedroom window to see a GHOST FACED FIGURE holding Olivia by the neck. She’s still aliv terrified, hurt, whimpering -- but alive.

Nooooo... Sidney watches as the GHOST FACE picks up the LARGE KNIFE Then, turns to the window and stares back at Sidney -- taunting her. Sidney SCREAMS. Beats the window. God... No... She jumps into action. She bolts from the bedroom. Running, racing, nearly falling down the stairs...  49
Get the police... She SCREAMS BLOODY MURDER. But she wastes no time stoppin She RIPS OPEN THE FRONT DOOR and...
Sid bolts out of the house, running across the street, SCREAMING HER LUNGS OUT.
He’s killing her! Where are you? She sees the DEPUTY’S PATROL CAR. Goes to it. But no sign of Deputy Hicks or anyone. She BEATS on the hood.
Where are you, people? Goddammit! Jill and Kirby come racing out of the house after Sidney. She SCREAMS at them.
Call the police. Now. She runs, bare foot, across the street. Kirby goes racing back inside the house while Jill debates.
Sid races up the drive, to the front door. IT’S LOCKED. S goes to the window next to it. She picks up a POTTED PLAN and throws it through. GLASS SHATTERS. Sidney climbs in after it.
Sidney can’t be stopped. She races through the living roo Her feet bloody from broken glass. She climbs the stairs.

It’s dark. Sidney sees a light through a door. She bursts through it to find... OLIVIA'S BODY on the bed -- propped up against the headbo Her stomach ripped open. Her insides exposed. BLOOD EVERYWHERE. She's too late. The sight overwhelms Sid. She erupts into tears. Her knees fail her. She clutches the door to keep from falling. Then, a PHONE RINGS.  50 Sid turns to find a CELL PHONE sitting on the dresser -- if waiting for her. She picks it up, brings it to her ear A long silence. And then...
(from phone) Welcome home, Sidney.
Nooooo...
I’ve missed you. Sidney is defiant. She SCREAMS in anger.
What do you want?
It’s time for another movie. I’ve been waiting.
Fuck you.

Only one more, Sid. It’1l be your last one. I promise. STAB. The Death of Sidney Prescott. Based on a true story. It’1ll be the best one yet. CLICK. The PHONE goes DEAD. A NOISE BEHIND HER. Sid spins around to see... Jill racing up the stairs.
Don’t come up here. But Jill doesn’t stop. She gets to the top of the stairca Sid goes to her -- to block her from seeing Olivia's body
No, please... Is she?

I'm sorry... Just as Sidney goes to Jill-- GHOST FACE LUNGES FROM THE HALL CLOSET -- KNIFE RAISED.  51 He BARRELS into Sidney -- but she’s fast -- she spins aro and KNOCKS him against the wall. As Jill races to help, t GHOST FACE turns on her -- KNIFE RAISED. Sidney LUNGES at him. The KNIFE STRIKES JILL IN THE ARM - slices open her shirt -- as Sidney and the GHOST FACE go TUMBLING down the stairs. Together -- intertwined. They hit the base of the stairs. Hard. The GHOST FACE instantly rises. But, Sid is disoriented. She tries to crawl away but GHOST FACE pulls her back when... Sidney KICKS the GHOST FACE off of her -- she scrambles t her feet, racing to the door, coming face to face with. DEPUTY HOSS AND DEPUTY PERKINS -- their guns drawn on her She turns around to discover -- GHOST FACE has disappeare Deputy Hoss takes off in pursuit while Deputy Perkins goe Sidney. He tries to help her -- but she pushes him away.
Where were you? Sidney is upset and angry. She sees Jill coming down the stairs, clutching a bleeding arm. Sid races to her. Sidne turns to Deputy Perkins.
Help me with her. Perkins springs into action, aiding Jill.
Crime scene chaos. SQUAD CARS, AMBULANCE, CORONER'S VAN,

text: An AMBULANCE SPEEDS away, revealing Dewey. He eyes Hicks with Perkins and Hoss -- marches over. They instantly sta defending themselves.
I saw someone in the Ghost costume. He went in the alley.
I saw him too, Sheriff.  52
And they radioed and I circled around to cut him off.
While the killer circled back to the girl’s house.
He got us with the other house, Sheriff. The Deputies know they screwed up. Big time. Just then, t CORONER and his TEAM carry Olivia’s body out of the house The sight weighs heavily on Dewey.
A small town hospital. The MEDIA has descended upon the m steps. CAMERAS and REPORTERS everywhere.

A flurry of activity. Whirls around Sidney and Jill. NURSES, MEDICS, DOCTORS... They're being treated side by side. Jill sits reclined in bed, as DOCTOR ORTH, 38, handsome and confident, bandages wound. She WINCES. Kate is there -- quietly panicked.
You didn’t hear us screaming?
Two glasses of wine and an Ambien. I didn’t hear anything. Just then, Kirby comes racing in.
They told me it was a surface wound. Surface wounds are okay. They hug.
Ow. Surface wounds hurt.

(to a nurse) Oxycotin stat.  53 Dr. Orth goes to Sidney, one bed over. An INTERN removes small bits of glass from her feet. Dr. Orth inspects it. With his right hand, he checks an abrasion on her foot.
It’s not bad, believe or not. How’s the head?
Massive hangover. The doctor holds her stare too long. Sidney senses it.
Did we go to school together?
You went to school with my younger brother, Steve. You may not remember, but he was...
Steven Orth. Yes, of course, I do. And he had a brother, Danny, who was in med school. He’s taken aback. Surprised, she remembers.

Most people forget about Steve. The guy tied to the chair in the back yard, killed off in the opening scene. Generic victim #1. Not even part of the story. The doctor clearly has some residual feelings. Over his shoulder, Gale approaches. Excitedly.
Dewey called me. I came. Whatever I can do.

You can help me find Rebecca. (to nurse) Have you seen my assistant? Sidney hops off the bed, WINCING as her feet hit the floo She slips into her shoes, not stopping. She’s leaving and very determined about it.
Dewey said you talked to the killer? What did he say?  54
He told me to leave town as quickly as possible.
He did?
He said the next STAB movie was about the death of Sidney Prescott. I interpret that as: Get the hell out of town now. Sidney sees a weary Rebecca entering. She’s shell-shocked
Good. You’re okay. Cuz’ there’s tons of press requests...
We're leaving tonight. We’1l drive to Oakland and fly standby. Where’s the rental?
In the lot. There’s a lot of press out there. Let me pull the car up. I’1l text you. Rebecca takes off -- grateful to be leaving. Gale watches Sidney collects her things.
Leaving may not be the best thing to do, Sidney. Sidney looks at her. Jill and Kirby take notice. As does Dr. Orth.
You're kidding me, right? I came back here and people are dead.
How were you supposed to know some psycho was planning a sequel?
You'd like that wouldn't you, Gale?
Excuse me?  55
Are you leaving, Sidney? Sidney turns to see Jill. Sid goes to her full of compassion.
Someone is out there killing people because I’m here. I have to go before someone else gets hurt. Beat. Sadly, this makes sense to Jill. To all of them.
The PRESS is having a field day with the news of another murder. Amongst the CROWD is Trevor. Watching.

Another young girl is dead tonight and Woodsboro is once again the setting for a real life horror movie... Rebecca emerges from the hospital. She hides behind TWO SECURITY GUARDS trying to figure out the best way to mane the crowd when Dewey comes barreling through. The REPORTERS swarm him as he makes his way to the doors. Rebecca uses this as her opportunity to flee. She darts through the crowd. Unnoticed. “Sheriff.” “A statement.” “Anything.” The Sheriff reaches the top of the stairs and turns to the CAMERAS as microph are shoved in his face.
I can assure you that we are doing everything we can to apprehend those responsible.
So you think there’s more than one killer?
We can’t rule it out yet. Reporters continue to grill him.  56

A dimly lit lot. Rows and rows of parked cars. Rebecca appears moving through them. She looks around, unable to remember where the rental is parked. She presses keys. BEEP. The RENTAL CAR’S LIGHTS FLASH two rows over. She starts for it when her CELL PHONE RINGS. S digs into her bag. Pulls it out with her ear piece. It’s marked BLOCKED CALLED. She answers, inserting her bluetooth ear piece.
(into cell) This is Rebecca.
(but not so obvious) Sidney Prescott please?
This is her assistant, Rebecca Walters. Can I take a message?
Yes, please? Rebecca starts to dig in her bag for a pen and paper.
Okay, sure, um... (thinks better of it) Actually, this is a really bad time. May I call you back? Rebecca crosses to the car. She regrets picking up the phone. So not the time for this shit.
It’s really important. It will just take a second.
What is it?
Please tell Sidney that it’s very important that she doesn’t -- are you writing this down?
Yes, I am.  57 Rebecca’s not writing shit. She’s lying.
Are you sure? It sounds like you're walking.
I’m writing. Who is this? Rebecca arrives at the rental car. BEEPS the door. Opens and slides in.
Please let Sidney know it’s imperative that she not leave town and to illustrate this I’m going to kill her assistant.

Excuse me...? CLICK. The phone goes dead. It takes a second for this to register. Horror fills Rebecca's face. She LOCKS the car doors, STARTS the ENGINE. Looks to the left and right then spins around and peers into the back seat. It’s empty. She turns back when--

head_text.subj: A HAND BURSTS THROUGH THE DRIVER'S WINDOW GRABBING HER

text: Rebecca’s SCREAM is cut short.
Sidney is still with Gale and Jill. Aunt Kate and Kirby a there too. Then-- Sid's CELL PHONE RINGS. The CALLER ID says Rebecca. She picks it up.
Bec? Are you out front?
Yes, Sidney, you'll find Rebecca right out front. Sidney face falls. Noooooo. She takes off running. Gale and the others follow.  58
Dewey continues to answer reporter’s questions at the hospital’s entrance.

The police department is working around the clock to make sure no one else is hurt. Behind the CROWD OF REPORTERS, Rebecca’s rental car can b seen drifting down the road. Coasting. Building speed on the road’s incline. Growing closer and closer -- headed directly for the CROWD. Finally, people start to notice. “Watch out.” The car is headed right for the hospital’s entrance. Dewey sees it.

Guys, watch it, move aside. Instant commotion. As the car parts the CROWD. Sidney and the others emerge from the hospital as-- The car CRASHES into a MEDIA VAN. Through the busted side window -- Rebecca’s lifeless body can be seen behind the wheel. Her throat slashed. Horrific SCREAMS from all around. As the CAMERAS film eve second of it.
A waiting room has been taken over by the police. Jill si on a couch -- Kirby is curled up asleep, next to her. Aun Kate is there too.
How's your arm?
It’s okay. Sore. Gale passes with coffee. She takes a seat next to Sidney. Offers her a coffee. Sid takes it.
Rebecca’s family has been notified. A long beat.
I never should have come back here.  59
This isn’t your fault, Sid. If anything it’s mine. I wrote the book, I sold the movie rights. I started this. Sidney looks at her.
You're right. It is your fault. But I knew better. (then) Now, I can’t leave. We have to keep her safe. Sidney is referring to Jill.
We will.
I don’t care what happens to me. But no one else can get hurt. Sidney is absolute and determined. Gale nods.
Dewey is with Deputy Hicks.
The Cyber team is working on triangulating the cell phones. We should have something soon. Gale marches up, determined.
Anything at all?
We’re on it, Gale.
Don’t do that. Don’t cut me out of this. I’m a part of this.
It’s not protocol, Gale, for the Sheriff's wife to be involved-- Gale spins around -- ready to rip Hicks’ throat out.  60
And who is talking to Deputy Judy? Not me. Dewey jumps in between them. Ushers Gale off to the side.
Okay, you can help. Just be nice. Gale looks at Dewey, very seriously. Very troubled.
We have to stop this, Dewey, before anyone else dies. He nods. In total agreement.

The sun rises over the majestic rolling hills of a beauti Northern California landscape. Quiet. Tranquil. INT. JILL’S BEDROOM - ROBERTS HOUSE - MORNING The sun shines through the window. Illuminating Jill in b Her eyes flutter open. She awakens. YAWNS. She gets up and peers out the window. Sees HOSS and PERKI below -- standing guard. Alert and ready. A GROUP OF REPORTERS camp out too. Then, across the stree
Covered in police tape. Now, a crime scene. A quiet momen As Jill truly awakens to the nightmare she’s living.
Sidney is drinking coffee, while talking on her cell.

(into cell) I’m staying. I'd prefer if everything could be channeled through your office. Thank you, Henry, I appreciate that. I’11 let you know more as I know it. Bye. Sid hangs up as Jill enters the kitchen. Sid goes straigh for her and hugs her. It’s comforting to Jill.
I’m sorry about Olivia.  61 Jill tears up.

You know when people say, “I know how you feel,” but you know they’re just saying that and have no friggin’ clue how you feel? (then) I know how you feel. Sidney’s look says it all. She does know. Jill appreciate it, finding comfort in Sidney’s quiet strength.
Where’s mom?
She stopped by work for a bit.
I saw all the reporters outside.
That's why we’re inside. Sid hands Jill a cup of coffee.
How do you deal with it? With everything that’s happened to you? You've seen so much...
Death? (a moment) It sucks. I hate my life. I didn’t ask for it. But running from it gets me nowhere. I’ve learned to embrace it.
How did you do that? Sidney shrugs.
I wrote a book about grief and guilt and hope.
And it helped?  62

It helped... pay the bills. The thing that helped most, which I worded differently in the book, is I finally said, “Fuck it.” This is it. Your life. You can boo-hoo or get on with it. I’ve earned the right to say, “Fuck it.” So I did. Sid is very frank. Jill appreciates it. She likes this si of Sidney.
I didn’t know you had edge.
(poised) I’m so polite, aren't I? Things are never what they seem, Jill. That I can assure you.
I don’t think I'd like the attention. People staring at me.
People stare at me? As if she didn’t know. Sidney smiles.
I won’t lie. I’d love to disappear. Be somebody else. Start from scratch. No scars. But that’s not reality. Jill smiles. In adoration. She looks up to Sidney.
The SHERIFF’S JEEP and TWO PATROL CARS are parked in fron Dewey and Gale are there with Deputy Hicks and SEVERAL OT DEPUTIES. A brainy technician, TONY, 30, holds open a laptop.

I triangulated the cell phones. The one used to call Jenny Randall, Jenny Randall’s cell that was used to call Jill Roberts and now Charlie Walker’s cell. Tony points to the laptop.  63 ON LAPTOP SCREEN -- A digital map of Woodsboro. Several CLICKS and it ZOOMS to the school. THREE BEEPS.
See the signal strength? Those phones are here. On this campus.
What’s the accuracy?
The Lab’s GPS can get within 300 feet. Gale takes the lead.
Great, you guys find the phones. Dewey and I will begin questioning suspects. They all stare at Gale. Especially Dewey.
(annoyed) What are you doing? Do you see this? It’s a badge. My badge. Where’s yours? Oh, right, you don’t have one.
You said I could come.
I said you could observe.
Consult.
Quietly. Hicks and the others watch their marital bliss in action. Dewey takes charge.
Now, you guys find the phones and we'll begin questioning suspects. Gale nods. She couldn’t have said it better herself.  64
A busy corridor. STUDENTS come and go, eyeing the DEPUTIE as they move amongst them. Mr. Baker is seen, watching to

head_text.subj: AT THE END OF THE HALL

text: Robbie has his FLIP CAMERA out, filming. While Charlie stands next to him.
Somebody is looking for a killer.
Incoming. Robbie refers to Dewey and Gale approaching.
Charlie Walker? Charlie raises his hand.
Gale looks around the room. Sees all the video equipment computers and film-making paraphernalia. And the posters the wall. Lots of horror movie posters.
What is this place?
Audio visual lab. We’re one rung below the Glee club.
We're awaiting our own TV show. We have hope.
First, let me just say, it isa supreme honor to be a suspect. May we film the interrogation? Robbie films with his FLIP. Deputy Hicks casually takes i from him. Dewey and Gale eye Charlie.
Where’s your cell phone, Where’s your cell phone, son? Charlie? Dewey looks to Gale. “Shut up”.  65
I lost it. It was stolen.
I don’t know what happened to it. Your Deputy asked already. I can’t find it. Not since lunch yesterday. I sat it down for two seconds to grab a burrito and a Rockstar -- gone.
He'll submit to a polygraph.
Where were you last night?

I know someone used it in Olivia’s murder. But it wasn’t me. I stayed in. Watched WICKER MAN. The original. Ask my mom. Look, I’m a horror junkie, to state the obvious, but I like my violence in movies, not in reality.
Maybe, you can’t tell the difference between the two.
I’m not Billy Loomis, Sheriff. If anything, I’m Randy, the film geek. I just got accepted to Tisch.
He drops that, “Tisch”, like it’s gonna get him laid.
That makes you a prime suspect in my book.
He’s right, he’s too obvious.
Thank you. Besides, I don’t do teen slasher. I’m more cult, Argento, early Lynch, my tastes are subversive.  66
Very subversive. Henry Knowles is irrelevant.
I'd never partake in some lame sequelitis retread.
Is that what you think is going on? Both boys nod. These guys are “Who’s on first” with their timing.
Oh yeah, someone’s trying to bring the STAB franchise back with a reboot.
Re-imagining.
And it sucks. It doesn’t need to be brought back. This genre trend of shit remakes needs to stop. Rob Zombie.
Michael Bay.

Because for every DARK KNIGHT there’s 50 PROM NIGHTS. Dewey looks to Gale. She shakes her head. These guys are harmless. Just then, a TAP on the door. Dewey looks up to see Deputy Hicks motioning to them.
Deputy Hicks leads Dewey and Gale through the school’s parking lot.
We got a hit. Tony is there with a cell phone.  67
Jenny Randall’s cell and Charlie Walker's cell. I’m dialing them now. A MUFFLED RINGTONE comes from the trunk of the car.
And now Charlie Walker's. A few seconds and the 2001 THEME RINGTONE plays.
Let’s open it.
Who's car is this?
It’s mine. What’s going on? They turn to see school teacher, Mr. Baker, approach.

We need you to open your trunk. Mr. Baker pulls out his KEYS and BEEPS. The trunk opens. The very first thing everyone sees is the GHOST FACE star up. It’s stained with blood. They all turn to Mr. Baker. Hands on their holsters. INT. JILL’S BEDROOM - ROBERTS HOUSE - AFTERNOON CLOSE ON THE TV -- THE LOCAL NEWS. It’s MUTED. Jill is on the bed with her laptop talking to Kirby -- vi iChat. Kirby is at her house.
I'm sick of this house. It’s creepy being here after last night.
Come over here. We’1l be sad together. Bring your body guards.
Maybe. I dunno what to do.
It’s two whole blocks. You'll be safe. I’m the one marked for death. I’m the sidekick. (MORE )
Second banana always gets it. You're the new Sidney Prescott. Survival rate high.
I don’t wanna be the new Sidney. I’ll see ya later. Okay?
(iChat) Buh-bye. Jill shuts her laptop. Gets up and exits.
Jill moves to the top of the stairs. She can partially se Sidney -- she’s on the phone.
(on phone) I’m postponing the tour indefinitely. I can’t... Jill returns to her bedroom. INT. JILL’S BEDROOM - ROBERTS HOUSE - AFTERNOON Jill enters, closes the door to reveal TREVOR. Jill JUMPS
Trevor. How did you get in here?
The same way I always do. The patio stairs. I had to see you. I’m sorry about Olivia.
You shouldn’t be here. He ignores this. He goes to her, inspects her bandaged ar
Are you okay? I was worried. I know I screwed up but I care about you. I can’t just turn that off. You were almost killed. His sincerity is convincing. Jill softens. Beat.
Do they have any idea who did it?  69
No. They think it’s, ya know, like in the movies. Jill can’t help herself. She's glad he’s there. Despite their issues. He takes her in his arms. They hug for a lo moment. Finally...
This doesn’t mean anything. I don't forgive you. But she continues to hold him.
You shouldn’t. I’m guilty. Jill pulls away. Looks at him.

I screwed up. I’m not going to lie. Not after what’s happened to you. Jessica and I lit up and got stoned, we messed around and got caught. None of it matters now. He’s powerfully honest. This hits Jill hard.
You lost your scholarship.
Guess I didn’t want it. That’s what my mom said. She said I sabotaged myself. Just then, the DOOR OPENS. It’s Sidney.
Hey, are you hungry? I’m sorry-- She's surprised to see Trevor in the room.
It’s okay, Sid. This is Trevor. He was just leaving. Trevor looks to Jill. She’s incredibly confused. Her face says it’s time for him to go. He gets up and starts out.
Yeah, I was leaving.  70 At the doorway, he passes by Sidney -- extremely close. Their eyes meet.

It’s nice to meet you. You’re smaller in person. Trevor and Sidney’s eyes meet. He smiles. It’s just enoug to make Sid uncomfortable. She takes a step back, allows Trevor room to pass. Then, covers to Jill. Just then, NOISE from outside takes their attention. They both go to look out the window. The REPORTERS are packing and taking off.
Something happened. They turn to the TV -- Jill HITS the VOLUME.
A suspect is now in custody. Jill and Sidney share a look.
Mr. Baker sits in the hot seat. Dewey questions him.
This is crazy. Somebody put those things in my car.
And how did they do that, Mr. Baker?
Twenty different ways to Sunday is how. C’mon, Sheriff--
Gale and Deputy Hicks watch.
He didn’t do it.
How can you tell? The evidence is overwhelming.  71
Because the evidence is overwhelming. Would you leave three cell phones, a mask, and a bloody knife in your trunk?
Mr. Baker is beginning to get worried.
Look, I’m being framed. It’s obvious.
Who would want to frame you?
I could make a list. I’m an asshole. Ask any of my students. Dewey slides a pad and paper towards him.
Why don’t you make a list?
I'm getting really nervous here. I think I should speak to a lawyer before this goes any further. Mr. Baker sits back in his chair. He’s done talking. Dewe looks to the mirror -- shakes his head.
Gale and Hicks continue.
He lawyered up fast.
He’s innocent.
Could I play devil’s advocate for a moment. Maybe he never thought we'd look in the trunk. Maybe he didn’t have time to dispose of the evidence. Maybe he’s stupid. Gale looks to her.
What would you like us to do, Deputy Judy?
I think we should hold him.
Sure, why not. And if no one else dies, then we’ll know you were right. But until then, we have a killer to find. 72 Gale starts off as Hicks stops her, troubled by something
Um, Gale? Small thing. It’s Deputy Hicks. Or Judy. But not Deputy Judy. Gale resists the urge to rip her apart. Instead,
Got it. Another small thing. It’s okay to be in love with my husband but if you ever act on it -- I’1l cut your balls off. Gale exits. Off Deputy Hicks--
A huge spatial home.
she smiles. A big family room/game room. A pool table and other games one side. A huge FLAT SCREEN home theatre set-up on the other. Robbie is shooting pool while Kirby is selecting MUSIC.
We should have guessed Baker. He was too quiet. Repressed mommy issues.
It’s this town. Woodsboro. It breeds psychos. Why are we listening to this crap?  73
Because tonight is about Olivia and I found her iPod in my car and this is her playlist. You’re free to leave. Kirby is adamant.
Great tunes, dude. To Olivia.
Thank you. Kirby moves into the connecting kitchen.

A spacious kitchen. Built into the walls of the kitchen a SEVERAL SECURITY CAMERAS. Kirby eyes one. Sees Jill and the Deputies coming up the walk. She races to the door. INT. FOYER - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Kirby opens the front door to greet Jill.
You made it.
They need to take a look around.
Sure. Come on in. Hoss and Perkins enter after Jill. They look around.
Sid sits in an over-sized chair watching TV. She channel surfs. It’s wall to wall coverage of the murders. A NEWS ANCHOR talks to a REPORTER in the field.
(from TV) Was an arrest made? Or is Stuart Baker only a person of interest?

It’s unclear. However, sources say the evidence is substantial.  74 Sid SWITCHES channels. More coverage. Images of the victims. Of herself. Past victims. (Randy, Tatum) Past killers. (Billy Loomis, Micky) The current victims. Gale’ book. Of Gale reporting. Past and present merge together with every flip of the remote. Sidney switches it over to a GOSSIP SHOW on the E CHANNEL

“Spatial Films announced today the next sequel in the STAB franchise has been fast tracked. No doubt due to the four murders that...” Sid gives up. She turns the TV OFF when she hears... TAT-TAT-TAT. A NOISE. She freezes. Looks to patio doors. Sidney rises and goes to the TWO LARGE GLASS doors that l to the deck and back yard. It’s dark. She FLIPS the back porch light. JUMPS. Startle by her own reflection. Jesus... She instantly sees the source of the NOISE. A WIND CHIME tangled itself around the post of the back porch. The nig breeze causes it to TAT-TAT against the post. She OPENS the door and steps out onto the...

Sid quickly tries to untangle the chime. She’s very vulnerable standing out there alone. The yard is pitch bl around her. She pulls on the chime and ends up bringing it down on to her. Shit. She then attempts to hang it back up but it’s too much trouble. Fuck it. She tosses it to the side of t porch. She steps back inside. Locks the door. TURNS the outside light out.
Sid enters the kitchen and goes to the fridge. Opens it a grabs a water when... TAT-TAT-TAT. Sid spins around to the family room.  75

Sidney approaches the back glass doors again. Pitch black She CLICKS on the porch light to reveal-- The WIND CHIME is now back hanging from the porch post. Right where it was. TAT-TAT. But how? Who put it back? Sid's face goes pale when-- KATE’S HEAD POPS UP FROM BELOW THE WINDOW. SID SCREAMS. Kate was bent over looking under a potted plant.
I can’t find the key. Sid recovers. Opens the door.
It’s okay.
Where is everybody? Kate goes inside.
The wind chime fell down.
The Deputies took Jill over to Kirby’s house. I thought it was okay. Away from me is always a good thing. Sid's making a joke. She shuts and locks the door.
Did you see they got the guy?
I saw the news. I haven’t heard from Dewey yet.
The English teacher. Figures. That calls for a glass of wine. Whaddya say? Kate starts for the kitchen.
You go ahead. I’m gonna turn in.  76 Kate nods. Disappointed, but she understands.
Sidney climbs the stairs and moves down the hall to her bedroom.
Sid enters the bedroom. Grabs her suitcase when her CELL PHONE RINGS. She grabs it -- sees the CALLER ID is blocke She debates. Then, answers it.
(into phone) Hello?
Hello, Sidney. Sidney freezes. Says nothing. Pure silence. GHOSTFACE (CONT’D) Nothing to say?
You called me. What do you want?
I want you dead. Sidney says nothing. GHOSTFACE (CONT’D) Whaddya say?
And then what? I die and then what?
The movie ends. (silence) Tell ya what, I’ll have a glass of wine while you think it over. Sidney BOLTS from the room. She goes racing down the stai
Sidney comes racing into the kitchen to find-- Aunt Kate pouring a glass of wine. She looks up, startled see Sidney so panicked.  77
What’s wrong?
We need to get out of here now. Sidney dials her CELL. Beat.
Dewey, Jesus, answer. (dials again) This is Sidney Prescott, I’m at Kate Roberts house, please, hurry. Just then, Aunt Kate’s phone RINGS. Kate answers it.

(into phone) Hello. (then) It’s for you. She holds the phone out but Sid won’t take it. Instead, s motions they need get out of the house. “He’s in the hous She points to her ear. “He can hear us.” Sid grabs a knif from the sink. Then, she leads Kate from the kitchen to t family room to the...

Sidney HITS the porch light to REVEAL-- GHOST FACE standing on the back porch. Kate SCREAMS. They both turn and race back through the house, through the kitchen to... INT. FOYER - ROBERT’S HOUSE - NIGHT Kate and Sid reach the front door. Kate UNLOCKS IT and RI IT OPEN to find...

text: Sidney SCREAMS. As Kate falls back against her. Sidney stumbles back against the wall. GHOSTFACE continues attacking, STABBING Kate repeatedly. Her body is a shield, protecting Sidney. Suddenly, POLICE SIRENS can be heard approaching.

Sidney races back through the kitchen to the... INT. FAMILY ROOM - ROBERT’S HOUSE Sid races to the back patio doors. She opens them, then stops when she sees... GHOSTFACE STANDING DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HER. What? Then, she realizes -- it’s not a person -- only a costume hangi from the wind chime. It was put there deliberately. She looks behind her just as... GHOSTFACE LUNGES -- BARRELS into Sidney. They both go to ground, tumbling, rolling across the grass of the back ya Sidney is thrown onto her back -- GHOSTFACE atop her. KNI RAISED. He STRIKES down. The Sheriff Jeep pulls into the drive. Dewey and Gale lea from the car, racing to the house. A SQUAD CAR is right behind them -- SIRENS BLARING.

Sidney is struggling underneath Ghostface. DEWEY AND GALE can be heard inside. So does Ghostface -- he looks to the house -- sees Dewey and others coming... It’s all the time Sid needs - she WHACKS GHOSTFACE. He tumbles over. Sid manages to crawl away... she gets to he feet and turns to find... AN EMPTY YARD. Ghostface has completely disappeared. A si gate swings ajar.
Dewey and Gale race to Sidney.
Are you okay?  79 Sidney nods as Dewey races to the side gate. Gun drawn. B the killer is long gone.
A PATROL CAR sits in the driveway of Kirby’s house.
Hoss and Perkins sit in the front seat, in mid-convo.
The cops guarding outside the house always get it. It’s a movie cop rule. It sucks to be a cop ina movie unless you’re Bruce Willis.
Not all cops die in movies.

No, but if it’s your last day before retirement -- you do. Or if you're a rookie and just found out your wife is pregnant -- you do. Or if your partner is better looking than you -- you do. Hoss looks in the rear-view mirror to judge his looks.
I win that one.
(seeing something) Who do we have here? Charlie and Trevor can be seen walking up to the house. Perkins FLASHES the RED LIGHTS. They stop. Hoss opens the car door.
I'll be right back. Perkins starts SNICKERING at him. Hoss doesn’t get it.

What did I say? Hoss gets out of the car. Starts for the guys.  80 INT. FAMILY ROOM - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Kirby is going through the MOVIE MENU on the FLAT SCREEN. Jill is on the couch. Robbie is in the kitchen making a drink.
Where’s the tequila? I have limes, margarita mix and no tequila. Kirby sends attitude his way.
There's vodka. Drink the goddamn vodka and shut up. (re: TV) What are we watching?
Zombies.
No horror. Please? I beg you guys. Can we watch a comedy or something?
A zombie comedy. You can’t go wrong with zombies. Just then, the DOORBELL RINGS. Kirby hands Jill the remot
Why don’t you pick? But nothing with Adam Sandler, Jim Carrey, Ben Stiller, Owen Wilson, Jack Black, or Will Ferrell. Kirby goes for the door.
And it can’t be directed by Brett Ratner. INT. FOYER - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Kirby races to the door. Opens it to find Deputy Hoss.
You got some visitors. Charlie and Trevor stand behind him. Kirby sees Charlie a points.  81
He’s cool, but I don’t about you. Does Jill know you’re coming? (to Hoss) Yes, they can come in. Charlie and Trevor enter. Kirby stops Trevor.
You be cool. I don’t want any bullshit drama. You upset Jill and you're out of here. She leads them into the house.
This isn’t a party. Okay? No ruckus. We’re very chill tonight.
Jill sees Charlie and Trevor enter. Kirby shrugs.
Just say the word and he’s 86.
I can go now. I don’t wanna want cause a problem.

It’s okay. Jill and Trevor share a look. EXT. ROBERT’S HOUSE - NIGHT - LITTLE LATER A CORONER'S VAN, AMBULANCE, COP CARS, REPORTERS are parke front of the house. Dewey is there. He speaks to Deputy Hicks.
We have to keep this out of the news until we notify Jill. Deputy Hicks nods, moving up the porch steps.
A PARAMEDIC bandage Sid’s arm. She’s surprisingly calm. Gale and Dewey are nearby.  82
We need to get you to the hospital.
It's okay, I’m fine. Sid turns to Gale.
Where’s Jill?
She's safe.
I should tell her myself. If someone could take me to her?
We’ll have her brought to the hospital.
No, I need to see her now. Before she hears about this. Gale looks to Deputy Hicks as she passes through.
Deputy Judy? Deputy Hicks hates being called that, but plays nice.
Yes, Gale.
Will you see to it that Sidney is taken to Jill?
Absolutely. Sidney rises.
Charlie and Robbie are playing a game of pool, in the mid of a heated discussion.
You're totally missing my point.  83
You're missing mine. The original STAB was an irreverent self aware post-modern deconstruction of the horror genre. How do you remake it?
You tap into the zeitgeist and take it to the next level.
And what’s the next level?
Post-post-modern unaware self awareness. The genre has evolved. The rules have changed.
No, they haven't. If anything it’s gone backwards. What rules have changed?
You don’t have to be a virgin to survive anymore. Kirby brings them drinks.
That’s just an update. You still have to be the less slutty one.
Don’t bring her into this. She knows nothing.
I can trivia you under any table.
Who played Leather Face first?
(instantly) Gunnar Hansen.
Smoke. Charlie gives Kirby a sexy stare.
I felt that. Did you feel that? That charge that moved between us just then. It was there. Kirby shoots him a look. “In your dreams.”
New rule. You can kill gay people now. You couldn’t do that in the 90's. Gay characters were off limits. Total social progress.
But racial awareness has not changed. The black person still can’t be the killer.
Yet. But Obama’s in office. He’ll change that.
The post-modern era of the 90's is what triggered these remakes to begin with.
It exposed the cliches so they had no choice but to start over.
Because there’s no such thing as a new idea.
That is sadistically sad. I refuse to believe it. So if you drink and do drugs -- will you live?
You can even say, “I'll be right back.”
Here’s the rule. Do the double reverse of every cliche and you'll be okay.
Trevor makes a drink. He holds up the bottle of vodka.  85
No thanks. He puts it down. He’ll pass too. He pours two sodas.
I can’t believe Mr. Baker was behind it. That’s crazy. Do they have any idea why?
Because he’s bananas. You should be happy.
Why?
He busted you good.
What do you mean?
Isn’t Baker the one who caught you in the locker room with the (mimes weed) and the (mimes tits)? Trevor resists ripping his head off. Charlie knows he’s stirring up trouble.
Gotta pee. Talk amongst yourselves. Charlie exits into the foyer, leaving Trevor and Jill alo
Baker is the one who caught you in the locker room?
Yeah, so?
I just didn’t know.
It’s not like I’m happy about it. Kirby grabs Jill by the arm and pulls her away.  86

You come with me. (to Trevor) We'll be back. Kirby disappears with Jill. Trevor watches as Kirby leads Jill upstairs. Trevor goes to the family room. The back patio doors are wide open. Robbie has stepped out on the back deck to smoke a cigare

Robbie lights up a cigarette. Looks around the back deck. Patio furniture, built-in barbecue, and bar. Manicured gardens. Green grass. A detached guest house in the rear. Very nicely done. Robbie goes to the bar and digs around. He finds tequila. Ah. Jackpot. He pours a shot when CREEAAK! A NOISE takes his attention. He looks around. But sees nothing. EXT. DRIVEWAY - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Hoss and Perkins are in the front seat.
I don’t know why we have to sit out here. They could have invited us in.
They would polite. They’re kids.
Time to do a perimeter check.
I'll go. I hate sitting in this car. I'll be back. Oh wait, I’m not supposed to say that -- am I? I won't be back.

Tricky area. In this situation when there’s a good chance you could return and find me dead, it could go either way. Hoss gets out of the car.  87 INT. BEDROOM - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Kirby’s alternative influenced bedroom. Jill and Kirby ar on the bed, chatting.
I can send Trevor packing. He’s acting all creepy eye.
I don’t think he knows what to say to me.
There’s something weird going on with him. Ya know, like he’s... (drops it) Never mind.
What? Say it.
All this STAB talk about remakes. If the killer was not only following the rules of horror movies but the plot of what happened before... he’s Billy Loomis to your Sidney.
Trevor’s not a killer.
I wouldn't guess Mr. Baker to be one either. Forget it, I watch too many horror movies. Jill falls back on the bed. Her mind reeling.
Can I get you something?
Do you mind if I just lay here for a second?
You take all the time you need. I'll be downstairs. Kirby gets up and goes to the door.  88
If you need anything, holla. Kirby exits, closing the door behind her.

Deputy Hoss moves around the side of the house. He comes a side gate. He checks it. It’s locked. He peers over the fence. He sees an empty yard. Everything seems okay. He starts back. EXT. FRONT YARD - KIRBY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Hoss comes around the side of the house. He crosses the front yard to the driveway to the PATROL CAR. He can see Perkins inside. Very still. Is he sleeping? Th closer Hoss gets, the more worried he becomes.
Perkins? He comes around to the driver's side. Sees clearly that Perkins is slumped over the wheel. He races to him. Suddenly Perkins lifts up, LAUGHING UNCONTROLLABLY.

You're too easy. Hoss wants to smack him but he’s STABBED IN THE CHEST. It comes fast and quick. FROM BEHIND. The KNIFE PENETRATES DEEP. Hoss CRIES OUT. Drops to the ground revealing...
